headline: 2023.09.17. - Project Kickoff: Drowning Detection in Lakes
texts: I am starting a new project aimed at preventing people from drowning in lakes. The project involves creating a model that can detect people in the water. Once people are detected, the model will track how many people are in each region of the image. By dividing the image into smaller regions, I can monitor the movement of people more effectively.

headline: 2023.09.23. - How to render markdown files dynamically in react.ts
texts: I have added a new feature to my web page where I can post content by creating a new object in my 'posts.json' file and dragging a markdown file into the posts folder. However, I faced some problems while implementing this feature and couldn't find a good article that covered all the necessary information. So, I decided to write my article explaining how I implemented this feature and how I solved the frustrating problems. If you are interested in implementing a similar feature on your website, you can read my article and find helpful information.

headline: 2023.09.30. - Quality Check with computer vision algorithms
texts: I created this thesis project in the past, as part of a larger production line monitoring system. It was a joint effort between my university, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, and the company Knorr-Bremse. The goal was to tackle a problematic step in the process and prevent potential failures. Together, we conducted research and development to create a solution for the problem.

headline: 2023.10.9. - How we build our software development methodology
texts: In this post, I will describe how we chose the software development methodology for our team by comparing scrum and extreme programming.

headline: 2024.02.28. - My Setup
texts: In this post, I will show my currently used environment for programming.
